translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions
The Chapter on the Conditions in Pairs

original: Āsavañceva sāsavañca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Sāsavañceva no ca āsavaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: āsavam ca iva sa āsavam ca hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  sa āsavam ca iva no ca āsavam hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With an object that is an effluent and related to an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in three ways.🔽With an object that is related to an effluent but is not an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in one way.

original: Āsavañceva sāsavaṁ hetuñca sāsavañceva no ca āsavaṁ hetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo
analyzed: āsavam ca iva sa āsavam hetuñca sa āsavam ca iva no ca āsavam hetuñca dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ
translated: With an object that is an effluent and related to an effluent as cause and with an object that is related to an effluent but is not an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in one way.🔽With an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in five ways.

original: ceva naanāsavo ca nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā🔽pañca …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka saṅkhitta hetuyā  pañca pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in one way.🔽With an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in five ways.

original: Āsavañceva sāsavañca nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo ceva nanoāsavo ca nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: āsavam ca iva sa āsavam ca na hetum dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ ca iva na noāsavaḥ ca na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, there is an arising of an object that is not an effluent and not related to an effluent as cause, with respect to conditions, in five ways.
